column4: Isn't there a way to get into cups via firefox?  localhost"4403 isn't it, but I thought it was something along those lines.  Also, anyone got an okidata microline320 working in ubuntu?
do you know what the username and password is by default?
craig: root and your root pw.

aha.  Further, (and I know this would be the case in Windows) should I reboot now that the printer is plugged in?  Test prints aren't working, but it did see it.  The only other time I've hooked up one of these was parallel, not usb
No need to reboot for a printer or something.
Why don't you use the normal printer setup tool from ubuntu?
I thought it would be fine.  Just checking; I fixed a windows box for someone last night and got into the habit again :P
it never asked to set up.  I went into printers, and there it was
Okay, and why exactly do you now want to fiddle with cups?
I didn't know if something was messed up in the gui testing area.  Thought I'd try right from cups.  Still no love though
'kay, it's late in the eavening here: Ubuntu did autoconfigure your printer. It did print the test page correctly. What is bothering you?
Okay, the printer is listed in the list of printers, correct?
got it.  I shut it off and turned it back on, just started a test page.
wow, the test page printing makes me think my cat got stuck in there-- lots of straight horizontal lines.
